page.title: 02Little Horsted Estate.
page.content: The five farms making up the Estate are owned by a Trust and total{750 {acres.}There are 130 Friesian cows, 200 young stock & 2 bulls. About{500 {acres}of{cereals}are grown; mainly wheat,barley,beans & grass for feed. There are 4{staff}plus a tenant farmer and two relatives:1 stockman,1 tractor driver,1 herdsman and a relief milker. The herd gives enough{milk}to supply {7500}people with daily 'pinta's' for a year. Each cow produces{6500 l p.a. They are milked at 05.00 & 15.00. The cows calve all the year. From October to April they stay in barns and are fed{silage}and bought dairy cake. More than 1800 tonnes of silage is made. Cereals produce crops for seed,feed & bread-making. In 1984,1 to 3 tonnes were yielded per acre. Each farm has a {crop rotation}but some land cannot be ploughed and is permanent pasture.
